intro: Rhodanthe oppositifolia subsp. oppositifolia, commonly known as the oppositeleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with opposite leaf arrangement and produces showy, pink to red flowers in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to a range of environmental conditions. It is part of the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal dunes. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
